cufy.concurrent

Class Lock<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • cufy.concurrent.Lock<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of that lock
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Lock<T>
extends java.lang.Thread
implements java.io.Closeable
    A java lock locker thread. Designed to be a replacement of wrapping the code with 'synchronized' statement. By creating a thread on the background to lock() that lock and hold it until unlock() get invoked.
    Since:
    07-Dec-2019
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

      protected java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger state

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this stream and releases any system resources associated with it. If the stream is already closed then invoking this method has no effect.

        As noted in AutoCloseable.close(), cases where the close may fail require careful attention. It is strongly advised to relinquish the underlying resources and to internally mark the Closeable as closed, prior to throwing the IOException.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread isn't the owner thread of this lock

      • run

        public void run()
        If this thread was constructed using a separate Runnable run object, then that Runnable object's run method is called; otherwise, this method does nothing and returns.

        Subclasses of Thread should override this method.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        Throws:
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread is not this
        See Also:
        Thread.start(), Thread.stop(), Thread.Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String)

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Hold the lock. Wait for the lock been gained.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - if this lock already closed
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread isn't the master of this

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Release the targeted lock by this.
        Throws:
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread isn't the master of this
